website_summaries.verdict: When you need a lot of rice, you need this programmable 20-cup rice cooker.
pros: Yields up to 20-cup of cooked rice
Steams meat and vegetables while rice cooks below
Programmable digital controls with automatic Keep-Warm and White Rice, Brown Rice, Steam, Flash Rice, and Slow Cook functions
cons: Water from the air vent can drip back down into the rice once the unit cools, creating mushy patches

website_summaries.verdict: You may end up waiting a bit longer for this combination unit to reach the ideal temperature, but it produces delicious results each time.
pros: Also serves as a heavy-duty rice cooker
Consistent, reliable results with the perfect texture and flavor
cons: Many consumers note that it takes a while for water to reach a hot enough temperature for adequate steaming

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, spews all over - See picture before you buy
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, writing this review after using this for 3 months, tried different quantity of rice and water, all as recommended, even with reduced quantity. Always spews liquid while cooking, see attached pictures. Really makes a mess out of the place and cleaning the cooker post this is also an issue, since all parts are not easily washable. Wanted to return now I can't since its outside the return window, really disappointed, Pls look elsewhere for better product.
customer_reviews.author: RtUser

customer_reviews.title: Never burn again
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily not for rice, I have a deficsted Aroma Rice Cooker. I am an older cook I began to forget food on stove, which is not unusual as we age. This allows nutritious cooking and I never have to worry when I leave “did I turn off stove” it goes to warm after cooking. Food always ready. Also for the young busy cook. I have sent this cooker to three young relatives they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sabida

customer_reviews.title: Melted after using on the first day and no refund!
customer_reviews.text: It’s got a plastic base and is not heat resistant. Melted after using for one day. I cooked rice and kept it on warm for several hours on my tile counter not next to anything and the cooker began to fall apart, the console separated and the whole thing got lopsided. I have never seen this with any rice cooker in my life, and I have used rice cookers since childhood. Very poor quality and no refund was allowed!
customer_reviews.author: Cali C.

customer_reviews.title: Inner pot expands over time
customer_reviews.text: I had been using this for around 10 months without any issues. But recently the inner pot expanded to an extent that it doesn’t fit the cooker anymore. Not sure what could have caused the expansion, but I am assuming it could be the cheap aluminum that its made of expanded over time. Anyways, avoid buying this if you are looking for something that’ll last long.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: unfortunately this has been a complete waste of money and a product we now have to ...
customer_reviews.text: Washed inside container per directions on top rack of dishwasher and it becomes completely bent and it will not fit into the base; making the entire product completely unusable. Product only has 30 day returns and support is only 60 days; unfortunately this has been a complete waste of money and a product we now have to replace!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Product is not safe
customer_reviews.text: This is not a well designed product. I made a cup of rice and the water boiled upward making contact with the plastic pieces of the rice cooker and my rice came out with blackish residue for the plastic and the hot water making contact. I would like my money back but unfortunately I threw away the box.
customer_reviews.author: John cena

customer_reviews.title: Idiot Proof
customer_reviews.text: This is so ridiculously easy to use, that this has been one of my most exciting purchases this year. I haven't tried brown rice or the slow cook features, but my experience so far has been phenomenal. I'm using it more for meal prep but it would be excellent for families. You use the cup that it comes with and each cup you put in, you add water to the matching water level. Hit a button and forget it. In about 30 minutes it's done - no mess. It allows me to prepare other dishes simultaneously without needing me to check on it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam L. Safianow

customer_reviews.title: Furious! Worst quality product! DON'T BUY THIS!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this higher priced rice cooker after the lesser priced one of the same manufacture-Aroma- de-laminated. I was assured this item was meant to last. I read reviews, I contacted others who wrote reviews. I was very careful with this product, washing it with a soft cloth, yet it is delaminating! I am easy on my things. There are no scratches, no sign of ill use, just a lousy, cheap product insidiously falling apart. I saw suspicious bumps or small white areas, and when I wiped at them small bits of the non-stick lining was left on the cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Derya Ruggles

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure it's a wonderful unit
customer_reviews.text: I've been ordering from Amazon for 20+ years. Well over 20 or 30k worth or merchandise. I bought this item for a friends wedding. He'd already gotten, very nearly, the same unit for his wife-to-be unbeknownst to me. The item is NOT returnable. Even if it's in an unopened box. The agent needed to stick by the rules, but sheeesh. Talk about holding your customers in low esteem. I'll need to rethink my online source for online shopping.
customer_reviews.author: Michael   Waterman

customer_reviews.title: Loved this rice cooker but didn’t even last me a YEAR!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rice cooker last December and I loved it. It cooked rice to perfection, and I would even do soups in this thing. 1 month ago it stopped working. It didn’t heat up anymore out of the blue. I have taken care of this rice cooker like it was my child since I loved it so much. I’m very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: Made in China = junk. My family used this cooker for a couple of months and the non-stick teflon began to peel away, now its garbage filler. It also burned my rice EVERY TIME with a thick layer of burned rice on the bottom. The heating is uneven and I'm sure there is some cancer-causing chemicald in it. Made in China = Trash.. We bought a "Mueller" - Made in Germany - it is FAR superior.
customer_reviews.author: Pepper power

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this rice cooker again, or recommend it as a gift
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much, so I was delightfully surprised. I'm still getting used to cooking with it, but everything I've made or steamed has come out good so far (rice, quinoa, fish, chicken, veggies). I don't like how once you open it the condensation from the lid will spill onto the rim, so remember to wipe that or it'll smell like whatever you're cooking. I would definitely recommend using a rice cooker cook book or looking up people's recipes online. Also, don't be afraid to add seasoning or substitute the water for broth to get really tasty rice/quinoa.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Dame

customer_reviews.title: How do the Wahlbergs fill it?
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my upstairs neighbor who loves the Wahlbergs. She is pleased with the product, but finds the water fill-line in the inner pot difficult to see. Except for this one flaw, she's happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G Aichelmann

customer_reviews.title: Aroma 20 cup rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: I love this Aroma Rice cooker, I owned one & aluminum scratched so I replaced it. I used it almost daily not only for rice but my husband cooked nurmerous foods in it while away from home. Now I cook soups, beans, root vegetables, and it’s become my most used appliance. I have even gifted some to family & friends. Can’t be without it! I wish the aluminum insert was more durable to scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Medicinal Gardens

customer_reviews.title: So easy a kid can do it
customer_reviews.text: This thing rules. You put in the rice, you put in the water, you hit go, and walk away. Nothing to it. The entire interior bucket where the rice gets cooked comes out, too, so you can clean it really easily. It comes with some extra bits for ancillary functions; you can apparently use it a steamer, even while cooking rice, which seems pretty neat. We've just used it to cook (LOTS) of rice, though.
customer_reviews.author: Azazelle Carter

customer_reviews.title: The design is terrible and causes my rice to stick to the metal ...
customer_reviews.text: Stay away from this product. The design is terrible and causes my rice to stick to the metal container like no tomorrow. It also burns out your rice if you leave it on the 'keep warm' option for more than an hour. If you have ever used an authentic rice cooker, you will know that this never happens.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money and more
customer_reviews.text: settings, settings, settings - plus a veg steaming tray AND up to 10 cups. I used this to make fried rice as a side for a guest list of 40 with EASE. I use it regularly for rice and quinoa - even added tomato, garlic, and a little chili and onion to make spanish rice in it. Timer works great, just double-check it if you're a knuckle-water-measurer like me; old habits die hard - sorry, instruction booklet. This thing is a natural home staple. One of the best kitchen buys I've made.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. H

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I used this product three to four times a week for the past four years....part of the handle broke today...I immediately sat down and order a new one. Perfect rice both white and brown....excellent slow cooker. Used the steamer for hard boiled eggs...potatoes, vegetables...great little machine. Love my new one just as much if not more. Easy to use more options....my soups and stews...wonderful. Doing Black Pearl Rice today...will add beans, vegetables, and smoked sausage...so easy. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Rheacty1

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Can i just say, this is my favorite appliance EVER! My daughter has the same exact rice cooker and she told me the same thing! This is definitely a timesaver. Come home from work, pour in rice, fill the pot to the line with water, add salt, add butter and press the appropriate button. And voila...you get perfectly cooked rice everytime! It works great with streaming corn and other veggies too. We bought this brand because of a recommendation from a friend of ours that has an older version and has had it for 5 years and its still going. Previously my husband bought a different rice cooker and it died after 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: N. Raukko

customer_reviews.title: It's everything you want in one
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely in love with this! There's no more need for a separate crock pot and rice cooker anymore. The size is large enough for a decent roast and while you have to make a lot of rice at once with this (the minimum is 4 cups), having leftover rice isn't a bad thing. This is great for a family, that's for sure. I'm moving out soon and wanted to keep things light so am leaving behind the old appliances this replaced and I'll have rice for days on my own. Not that I mind, I'll also have tons of crock pot meals and steamed veggies.
customer_reviews.author: khaosstar

customer_reviews.title: This Rice Maker is Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't order the fancier $80 one, but instead got the basic $40. I really love this Rice Cooker Steamer. It's one of those purchases I am glad I made. It makes damn near perfect rice. I've tried so many different techniques to making perfect rice myself in a pot on the stove. This does it way better and far easier. and the Giant metal non-stick pot is easy to clean. I think because of the size you have to make 2 cups minimum.
customer_reviews.author: Edmund J. Witkowski III

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 20+ year old Zojirushi. This was 1/5 the price of a comparable size Zojirushi. While it doesn't have the same bells and whistles, I've used this rice cooker for almost a year now and it still works great. It makes perfect rice every time. Steaming dumplings is super easy. If I get another 3 years of solid use, I'd say this was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: charshew

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY! Cord broken. No replacement. No Help from Aroma Customer Service.
customer_reviews.text: NO CUSTOMER SUPPORT FROM AROMA CUSTOMER SERVICE. POWER CORD BROKEN AND CANNOT BE REPLACED ACCORDING TO FACTORY REPRESENTATIVE. OSTER CORD UNPLUGS AND CAN BE REPLACED ECONOMICALLY! DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON AROMA RICE COOKERS. I can't get anyone fron AROMA CUSTOMER SERVICE to return my email so I can get the BROKEN POWER CORD(See Pic) replaced. I'll try to contact AROMA again, but other than that I think this is a GREAT RICE COOKER. Thanks for reading.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P. Mcguire

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but could be better
customer_reviews.text: Cooks a new batch of rice fairly fast and well and is easy to clean. Biggest let down is how limited you can keep you rice in it on keep warm setting. If I cook a batch on the morning for breakfast and come back after work, the moisture does not exit the chamber efficiently and ends up dripping back into the pot creating soggy, nasty rice in the bottom. I've had other brands that never had this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: I honestly bought this to turn garlic into black garlic, by slow cooking whole cloves for 2 weeks (carmelizing). Unfortunately, the Keep Warm mode turns itself off after 12 hours. This was not mentioned anywhere in the User's Manual. I therefore have to restart it twice a day. I chose this unit because it has a latched lid, not just a glass lid, thus being quite versatile for all cooking and not drying out the food. It is just a simple slow cooker (low temp) and that is just fine at this price point. The push buttons work fine. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: Very Good, Not Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It makes the rice easily, and clean up is incredibly easy. The reason I give it four stars instead of five is the rice that's on the bottom of the pot gets done more than the rice at other areas. I don't find it terribly bothersome, but it's mildly disappointing. Also, one person asked in a question if there was any reason not to get the 20 cup cooker, to which they answered no. This cooker puts two cups as the least amount of rice that it gives directions for cooking. I used to make one cup at a time, so a smaller size might handle that better for some.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Mills

customer_reviews.title: Recipient of this gift is enthralled!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a smaller ricer for about 30 years and I still love it (they probably don't make my brand anymore. I gave this one to a friend who has a husband and four children. SHE LOVES IT!!!!! The perfect rice, she said,. She made wild rice and it was WONDERFUL, fluffy, WONDERFLLULL. Everyone does not need a slow cooker, but everyone needs a ricer!
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Rice comes out dry if following directions.
customer_reviews.text: The reviews were correct on this one. From the beginning, it does coom well, everything is easy to use, great design, and easy to clean. BUT the pamphlet gives you the wrong rice to water ratio. When i did it by the instructions, my rice came out dry. When I did 2.5 cups rice with 4 cups of water for 20 min, my rice came out perfect! Unfortunately it is non-refundable. Will probably donate it and try the Instant rice cooker instead.
customer_reviews.author: jowell d mcfarland

customer_reviews.title: Consistently perfect rice for over a year
customer_reviews.text: We use this primarily for cooking rice, which we do at least once a week. It has consistently made perfectly cooked rice over the past year that we have owned it. It is so easy to use that my son will make rice on his own when he feels in the mood for it without bothering us. It is also a snap to clean. The nonstick inner pot has held up well, we regularly use it to store excess rice directly in the fridge, which then gets used for yummy fried rice the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Taco

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, but mainly, Great Rice!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Options for making a variety of dishes. However, being Asian, the most important thing is, good rice! We have rice almost every day and after using a previous Aroma rice cooker for over 10 years, when a piece of plastic broke on the lid, instead of repairing it, we decided to get another Aroma rice cooker because of its reliability and good rice. When new crop rice is used, I use the regular mode. If an inferior rice brand is used, I use the 'Sushi rice' feature to make sure the rice turns out more 'sticky' and plump (Asian preferences).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing. My boyfriend and I are both body builders, and we eat A LOT of rice!! We had a small 3 cupper rice cooker and I would have to use it 3 times when I food prepped to get enough rice!! This is perfect! Makes so much rice and the directions are perfect and easy to follow. If you eat a lot of rice, or entertain a lot, this is the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: natalie

customer_reviews.title: Work horse that makes everything you want and rice
customer_reviews.text: Great product very versatile. Cheaper on Amozon than anywhere else, and Im a shpper. We uses it to make chile, PotRoast, chicken soup to die for, and other things my wife makes that im not interested in learning about, plus rice every a week. Hard core dependable a workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: RicoCST#2018

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Dont waste your time with this. It didnt last 3 months. You can buy a cheap name brand rice cooker that will knock the socks off this junk. Iny wife is Asian and eats rice daily. If your in the same shoes buy the cheap basic ones. The last a couple years and are easy to clean. Definately never buying this one again!
customer_reviews.author: Z Knisley

customer_reviews.title: Favorite adult purchase
customer_reviews.text: We love rice in our house and this is so easy to set up and use and it cooked the rice perfectly. I appreciate the countdown for the last 10 minutes that the rice is cooking. Removing the dish to clean it is very easy. Comes with pretty clear directions and a few recipe ideas which is nice. Bought a warranty just in case but I doubt I will be needing it.
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: It works just like it says
customer_reviews.text: It works just like it says. If you follow all the instructions exactly you should have no problem perfect for the kids learning to cook. Kids always walk away and forget they are cooking this is perfect you don't have to worry about burnt pots or burnt rice. It turns to warming as soon as its finished. Uses less water than the stove top directions. Clean up is easy. I recommend this for every parent trying to teach their young ones cooking or even college kids dorm rooms, doesn't take up much room and you can set the function and walk away while you are studying and in 2 hours your dinner is done. Hope this review helps.
customer_reviews.author: james davis

customer_reviews.title: Keypad pooped out.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this and used it daily to make make dinner. Within a week the keypad lights began spinning and the timer wouldn’t activate. The red bars would just spin around and no timer. I’m not sure if I just had bad luck with this one but I’m going to try to find something with less electronics if such a thing even exists anymore. I’m getting to where I hate these digitized keypad appliances. The fact is that simple knob turn things just lasted longer. Yes, I’m old.
customer_reviews.author: mc2Designs

customer_reviews.title: Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Good price and quality is almost the same as those Japanese made rice cookers. The price is just 1/5 of those well known brand. Rice cooked perfectly. I bought it to replace my old cooker. It’s better than expected. You can’t go wrong with this price. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: DAP

customer_reviews.title: The little engine that could
customer_reviews.text: This baby is amazing!!!!!! Brought this to steam food for our baby. That’s just a fraction of what it does. Perfect rice. Seriously... perfect. I tried adding more rice or more water and it’s always perfect. My 7 month old can do this! Also it slow cooks to. Made some amazing soup with this. So happy we found this.
customer_reviews.author: SdAaron

customer_reviews.title: Beware of warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Bought back in April of this year (2015) and within 3 months the non-stick started chipping off. Now (December) it doesn't even work anymore, it doesn't even power on properly, starts cycling trough the buttons and sometimes it stops but the buttons won't function, other times it stops on one of the buttons but doesn't let you switch to any other choice. Had another Aroma that was near 10 years old and not an issue, wish I had not given that one away. Update (Jan 4 2016) Contacted Aroma directly and they were able to process a replacement under warranty. Will update this review in the future if I still have the problem with the non-stick coating.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Amazing rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the bees knees, so to speak. So incredibly easy to use and cooks rice perfectly. I meal prep so I usually cook a total of about 14 cups of uncooked rice in one day; 7 in the first batch and 7 in the second. Once I'm done, cleaning it is a breeze since the pan has a non stick coating. I feel like I don't even need to use soap to clean it. If you are looking for a rice cooker, I would highly recommend this one, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Thomas

customer_reviews.title: We love it! We barely use the stove anymore!
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome. We had a smaller one that broke so we decided to get a larger one and its perfect! We just slow cooked pork shoulder last night for carnitas. We can cook spaghetti and so many other meals in one pot! Is perfect for ramen! Protip: we STEAM everything. 😋 5 minutes is usually enough to cook almost anything. Quick breakfast? Put in some chorizo bacon/sausage, onions and eggs: Done in 5 minutes! Dont forget tortillas in the steamer basket! Next is a pressure cooker!
customer_reviews.author: Aton B

customer_reviews.title: Easy rice cooker and more
customer_reviews.text: This is literally the best ever! It has easy to follow instructions and can do so much! Although the broccoli cooks fast so make sure you put it in for a short time if you don’t want it soggy. It makes perfect rice and it’s very simple. It’s easy to clean as well. Although it’s a little large to keep on a counter top, putting it away is no problem since all the pieces fit inside.
customer_reviews.author: HonestAmazon

customer_reviews.title: GREAT APPLIANCE--TREAT IT CAREFULLY
customer_reviews.text: I loved this rice cooker. It's easy to use, produces perfect ric every time, etc. I had mine for a little over a year (according to my Amazon records). I think it could have lasted much longer...but just now I dropped the insert container. And now it won't fit easily into the cooker and the lid can't close over it. So, great product, but don't drop the insert because apparently that'll be the end of the product's life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it!
customer_reviews.text: Water seeping out from everywhere! Quinoa all over it coming out of the vents! Only put 4 cups in. It’s also very flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: High quality and cost effective
customer_reviews.text: This is my first rice cooking/steamer. I have used it several times since purchased. It has outperformed my expectations. This product has a nice easy to use digital control system and know that I will get many years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Howard D. Kessler

customer_reviews.title: The Rice Cooker is not working as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed that the rice cooker is not working as expected. The rice appears over cooked and leaving dried rice on edges of the rice cooker and the "Keep Warm Light " shut off automatically after few minutes leaving the rice cold and defeating the purpose of fresh looking cooked rice
customer_reviews.author: ROLAND OVENSERI

customer_reviews.title: Finally a good one
customer_reviews.text: I have had many rice cookers and this by far has been an Excellent investment! I cook for many people at one time making multiple dishes at a time. I took this on a camping trip and boy was the yellow rice and curry chicken a hit. So was the chicken noodle soup. This thing really surprised me. It's super light weight and easy to clean. After a couple months the inside dish is still holding up well. Pretty scratch resistant and cooks food thoroughly and evenly. You have to give this one a try.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Versatile small appliance
customer_reviews.text: We purchased for brown rice but also love how steel cut oats cook up. I also steam all kinds of fresh vegetables. The keep warm feature works well for rice and oatmeal but you need to pull out veggies like broccoli and asparagus or they will turn mushy. We use the delay cook feature for oatmeal so that it’s ready when we come down for breakfast.
customer_reviews.author: Kionore

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Great for moms!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I used the steamer feature for zucchini today and it was amazingly easy! I would highly recommend this to any new or soon to be mom's out there. The delay timer alone made me love this as I can prep the rice in the morning and come home to it being perfectly cooked and ready to eat. But now I discovered how great it is for making your own baby food! I can steam the vegetables and throw them straight into the blender. Then freeze the puree in ice cube trays before moving to freezer bags and having healthy baby food ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: DJMKSBB

customer_reviews.title: fast but terrible rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this is an amazing rice cooker as it doesn't produce a lot of steam so it doesn't get all over the house. BUT It's such a bad rice cooker!!!!!! All the rice on top is raw and the ones at the bottom is soggy....such unevenly cooked rice!!!!! If I need to reduce the amount cooked then why even bother get a bigger one???
customer_reviews.author: RatherHonest

customer_reviews.title: one of my favorite kitchen gadgets.
customer_reviews.text: very convenient kitchen gadget. We cook a couple of cups of rice daily and this makes it super easy. Just add rice, double the amount of water, close and turn on. 35 mins later it's finished and will automatically flip on the "keep warm" mode for up to 12 hours. if you want to leave hot rice on all day i would periodically add water and stir so it doesn't dry the rice. we used the slow cook option twice and it worked well to cook some burger patties that i mix with the rice. Clean up is very easy as the tub is non-stick.
customer_reviews.author: Cannon23

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with the way this item works. I've found it easy to use and cooks rice perfectly every time. Update: I found myself using this product several times a week for several months due to delays in my kitchen remodel. It has only improved my view of this product. It's been used to slow cook soups, stews, and chili, steam vegetables and potatoes, and keep meals warm. It has exceeded my expectations in nearly every way, and it's larger than a standard crock pot which really helps when cooking for several days/larger groups.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: We love our rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: We love our rice cooker! I had never been able to cook normal rice and have it turn out ok. It was either too mushy or crunchy. With this rice cooker the rice comes out perfect every time! I have had mine for several years now and just bought another one for a friend as a wedding present. I like that it has several functions, brown rice, white rice, slow cook, etc. I have made several different kinds of rice and each time I am impressed with the results. It works well to make just enough rice for my husband and I as well as for large crowds of people. I won't ever go without my rice cooker again!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany H.

customer_reviews.title: It's so easy. To be able to do that and steam ...
customer_reviews.text: I make rice all the time with this now. It's so easy. To be able to do that and steam vegetables at the same time takes a lot of the hassle out of dinner. just set it up and do something else. The slow cooker option actually cooks chopped up chicken breasts REALLY quickly and has the meat very moist. I guess it's really designed for things like beef stew but if you want to saute some chicken and don't want to stand over the stove, just do slow cook and you are good to go.
customer_reviews.author: TBS

customer_reviews.title: Party Pot
customer_reviews.text: Basically bought this to make more brown rice since the rice cooker we have only holds half this amount. The only problem is--it doesn't stay warm past 12 hrs. You have to keep pressing the warm to maintain the heat, when there's extra rice left. Also, the bottom tends to dry thy rice out, when kept on too long, unlike the smaller pot. It's best to use when all of the rice can be consumed at once--by many.
customer_reviews.author: Fran B.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.  Works well and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Really good. After returning the Costco one due to a recall (though it was really good also) we found this on Amazon and love it! Who thought rice could be so yummy when prepared and cooked properly! No more instant rice out of a box for us. This one also has lots of options we have yet to try out, but it certainly works swell and is easy to clean (plus).
customer_reviews.author: Cheetahback

customer_reviews.title: A kitchen staple
customer_reviews.text: Helps make dinner a breeze....throw rice in the bottom, steam veggies on top and only have to cook your meat yourself. Very easy to figure out and setup.
customer_reviews.author: KeepOnMovin

customer_reviews.title: Good rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it for the past few months for college, and so far has been a really useful investment for making rice. Button functions are straightforward and nothing is really confusing. I would suggest a smaller size since this particular pot takes a bit more space than I expected, but that is a minor inconvenience at most. Nonetheless, I recommend this product/brand to anyone looking for a rice cooker!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Big capacity.  Perfect rice.  Perfect Steam.  Easy!
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I would need a rice pot until I needed some super simple appliances that kids could use when learning to cook when I was down and out for some major surgery. Now even my 10 year old can make rice with ease! Big enough for a large family and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Babs

customer_reviews.title: Time is valuable, get this cooker.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always been too proud to buy one of these and just stop cooking the rice myself. Long story short I was dumb and when life got busy this robot gifts me some time to worry about other things. Also, first one I ordered showed as “Like New” and was a piece of junk that obviously did not work and was sold again. Grief of returning and reordering aside, the cooker is amazing. Love all the settings.
customer_reviews.author: Rebeca R

customer_reviews.title: Love this rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: I love this rice cooker, it is a big larger on the counter top but I do have the ability to store somewhere else. I have had it several months now and still love it. Makes wonderful rice and steams veggies well also! I do recommend keeping the instructions booklet or google was able to help me as well.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Rice is sticky!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make more brown rice since the rice cooker we have only holds half this amount. The only problem is--it doesn't stay warm past 8hrs. You have to keep pressing the warm to maintain the heat, when there's extra rice left. Also, the bottom tends to dry thy rice out, when kept on too long.
customer_reviews.author: Zulaa Zulaa

customer_reviews.title: Best lazy vegan kitchen product I've bought.
customer_reviews.text: This is great for rice, pasta, and so much more. You can easily cook whole meals in this pressure cooker. Quick and easy steamer too. My only complaint is that the top doesn't come off easily for cleaning. Sure you can wipe it with a rag but sometimes the cleaning requires a bit more and disassembling the top to clean between the rubber gasket is a bit of a pain. Would be 5 stars, for an otherwise perfect appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: a disappoint compared to the old model
customer_reviews.text: I have a similar model(from the the same maker) for about 10 years and I decided to replace it. After 3 month usage, I concluded that I couldn't give it a score more than 3: the water constantly comes out of the steam vent, making a mess on the lid, as well as adjacent counter area. You have to make sure that the top space is clear as well, otherwise any object immediately above will sure to catch a lot of steam: I am sure it is not good for wood cabinets. It matters little if I use the setting of white rice, slow cook or brown rice. Now I regret that I tossed my old cooker.
customer_reviews.author: huaping mo

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: This is the 6th or 7th rice cooker I have had in my life. 30+ years of cooking rice in a rice cooker has made me too lazy to do it on the stove. We decided to try this low cost America’s Test Kitchen recommendation after our last Japanese rice cooker died(it was 10+ years old). Aroma cooked the rice well enough but it did not keep it warm and edible for more than an hour or two. Very disappointing. Our old rice cookers could keep rice moist and delicious at least 24 hours! I have returned it and purchased another Japanese brand rice cooker. We’ll see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Melanieb

customer_reviews.title: Its a great rice cooker when it comes to cooking
customer_reviews.text: Its a great rice cooker when it comes to cooking, the downfall is that the measuring cup comes with it is smaller than the original ! cup measurement, So the actual 10 cup rice cooker becomes kind of 8 cups of uncooked rice, maybe a little less too. Another thing is that it says you can leave rice in warm more for long hours but i just left the cooker in warm mode for 1 hr and the white rice at the bottom was brown. That said the cooker is great for steaming chicken, fish and vegetables . I make baby food with the steamed veggies and fruits like apples, pears etc.
customer_reviews.author: Abmgaj

customer_reviews.title: Perfect rice
customer_reviews.text: I use this rice cooker almost exclusively for rice and it makes the rice PERFECT. Once I put everything in, I just push the buttons and walk away. Once it beeps, the rice is ready and will be kept warm for several hours.
customer_reviews.author: JoeyNick

customer_reviews.title: It was PERFECT!! So perfect my 14 yr old loved ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow!! As soon as I got it I cooked long grain white rice in it. It was PERFECT!! So perfect my 14 yr old loved it. To be honest, he’s the one that ordered it! :> he wanted perfect rice like in the restaurants & he/we got it!! HIGHLY recommend. You won’t be disappointed! We’re yet to use its other cooking features.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy S.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love my rice cooker. Now I can make all kinds of rice and not think about it. Just fill it, set it and go about your business. It will beep to let you know it’s ready. Will start to count down from 10 minutes visually if you’re in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the Buck!
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing rice cooker! Great capacity, consistent cooking, and easy to operate. There's a variety of modes you can put it in for various things, such as cooking rice, steaming veggies, or slow cooking, but you certainly don't have to use them all even though you should try them once. Really impressed, especially with how Basmati rice comes out in this cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Butler

customer_reviews.title: Just don't !
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this broke on me and my wife is mad as !@#$$%^^#@$% lol at me
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: 20 Stars & 20 thumbs ☝
customer_reviews.text: I love this rice pot I bought 2 one for my youngest daughter who does all the cooking. She loves it. It even cooks Basmati rice beautifully. I bought one for my youngest son he loves it & one of my other daughters bought one for herself. If I could I would give this pot 20 stars.2
customer_reviews.author: ms rabia

customer_reviews.title: I just bought a second one to send with my son in college!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rice cooker 2.5 years ago to replace another Aroma rice cooker. It is still working great! When my son asked for a rice cooker to take to college, I didn't hesitate in ordering the same one. It cooks rice perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Good appliance
customer_reviews.text: Bought this version to replace old model. They've made improvements on a few things and I think it's for the better. The steam vent is one piece which is easier to clean. The lid is all one finish on the inside, which is also an easier feature to clean! Good rice cooker and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered didn't work from the start, once you turned power on and pushed a button to start cooking the power would shut off after about 20 sec power wouldn't turn back on unless it was unplugged then plugged back in, Amazon gave me a replacement it arrived in 2 days just tried it out for the first time with white rice and it worked great rice came out prefect, hopefully it cooks brown rice just as good, I will continue my review with more use
customer_reviews.author: brad pryor

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good so far
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good product since I've had my previous one for 5 or 6 years. The only reason for 4 stars is because of the spatula. It's weirdly shaped, very thin and bends. My previous one was thicker and sturdier. I actually still use the old one with the new cooker because I'm afraid the new spatula will break. Other than that, it's a good product, I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mottobella

customer_reviews.title: I like that. It's intuitive
customer_reviews.text: I never read the instructions, and I can do everything I want. I like that. It's intuitive. Cooks rice, lentils, or quinoa perfectly (I like to blend all 3). I also like that you can steam veggies over the rice. The timer function is simple and works, and it keeps things warm without burning it. I don't know why anyone would get a smaller size; it's nice to have the option to make a ton of food.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Durling

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the most useful kitchen purchases I've had
customer_reviews.text: I have made cake in this rice cooker, I have made quail, rice, vegetables, and the list continues to grow. This is one of the most useful kitchen purchases I've had!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: This model isn't satisfactory. The rice is always cooked unevenly.
customer_reviews.author: Grant S Buse

customer_reviews.title: Multi Use slow cooker
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son and he opened it and used it immediately. He made some rice and steamed vegetables. He doesn't like to cook so this was a real hit for him to do that. It was easy to use and clean up. Many different uses with basically pushing a button. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K. Posch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product at a steal for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product at a steal for the price. The slow cooker option works well but seems to only run on high, so if you're using a recipe that calls for low setting you need to cut the time in half and eyeball it to make sure that everything is cooked properly. As a rice cooker and vegetable steamer it works flawlessly and makes rice with no hassle, and gives me some vegetables to eat with it at the same time! This is a must have if you're trying to save a bit of money or just eat healthier by incorporating more rice into your diet.
customer_reviews.author: I just like music

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and works great. I've been using it about once every week or so and it's never made a bad pot of rice or one-pot meals. Also great for hard-boiled eggs and steaming chicken breasts or vegetables. Nonstick finish on the pot is holding up great and shows no signs of wear despite always being run through the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: David Beach

customer_reviews.title: Good cooker!
customer_reviews.text: I love this rice cooker with the exception of cleaning....the bowl itself is easy to clean and removable, but the lid is attached to the base of the cooker and is a pain to clean. I want to be able to clean every aspect of my cooker, and there are places i just don't feel get clean enough. I love how versatility it is! i have cooked many things other than just rice and i am impressed every time!
customer_reviews.author: celina rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Rice from Day 1
customer_reviews.text: Personally, I thought I made rice pretty well (pot, lid, rice, water, and salt). So I was a little hesitant to buy a rice cooker, but my husband seemed really amped to buy one. Do you think he was trying to send me a message.... In any event, we bought this. I can attest that there has never been a day since that I have regretted the purchase. WE LOVE THIS COOKER! It takes just a minute or two to put in the rice, water, salt, push two buttons, and then wait for the beep to tell me it is done. The rice is sticky and perfectly cooked. It could not be any easier.
customer_reviews.author: Team Sweetpants

customer_reviews.title: Wow, this is nice
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a 20 year old rice cooker and the difference in quality is unbelievable. It's fast and makes perfect rice. We haven't tried to steam veggies yet, but it's capable. The perfect addition to our kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Jack D. Diem

customer_reviews.title: Great cooker
customer_reviews.text: Anyone complaining of soggy or dry rice: You need to dial in your recipe. If your new cooker doesn't work like your old one, that's an adjustment you have to make, not your cooker. Different breeds or brands of rice can require radically different amounts of water, and it can take some trial and error to find the right ratio of water to rice for your specific case. However, once you find the sweet spot, this cooker gets it right every time. I don't get any variance in quality between uses, and the huge capacity is a plus in a household like mine.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wade

customer_reviews.title: worst thing for cooking rice
customer_reviews.text: I am only reviewing this as a rice cooker Straight up Trash the rice is wet and mushy, cant keep the river longer than a few hours if you keep it on warm the rice start to get really wet. its terrible stick with the Tiger rice cooker, pay the extra money its worth it
customer_reviews.author: phonesavanh

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid and versatile
customer_reviews.text: i just bought this for my mom as she was complaining about her rice cooker that took too long to cook. So I bought her this Aroma which is basically the same one I have had sitting on my kitchen counter for ages. It's fast and super reliable. I've used it to cook white rice, brown rice, quinoa and oatmeal and couldn't be happier. I bought mine a number of years ago after I got sick of using yet expensive Japanese one with the fuzzy logic that just took too much thinking to do the simplest task (and it took forever to cook). It's rice; why make it so complicated?
customer_reviews.author: Keel

customer_reviews.title: I love this guy
customer_reviews.text: I had this problem of rice water overboiling and making a mess on my stove. Not anymore. I love this guy. It makes perfect rice every time, and I've had no issues. No starchy liquid overboiling, no overcooking and burnt rice. The only thing I wish was different is the display. When it's cooking, lights flash in a weird pattern. I wish it had a countdown instead. I'd also love some suggestion of when it's about to go off or how much time remains. But that isn't necessary. It's still a great little guy. ETA: I don't rinse my rice first, and I didn't have any boiling over issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn F

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cooker based on hundreds of great reviews, but it's a disappointment. No time indicator on the machine is an annoyance, but the biggest problem is over-cooked rice. Adding additional water (more than instructions indicate) is necessary to keep it from burning. "Keep Warm" is, however, guaranteed to burn the rice every time.
customer_reviews.author: 1derwoman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing purchase
customer_reviews.text: I can’t make rice to save my soul, even with this product. I tried several different types of rice and used the directions in the rice maker box. I used the given measuring cup and still came out with stuck together rice clumps. I wish I sent it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Flynn

customer_reviews.title: The best rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker is great! My family eats rice everyday and this makes more than enough to last us a few days. I love all the different features. The flash rice setting makes rice in under 20 minutes so if you’re in a rush it’s perfect. Easily steamed vegetable and can be used to make other things besides rice. I made stew the other day and it came out perfect! I just popped everything in and forgot about it for a few hours. I’m super pleased with this purchase. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Brieanna Welch-Chenier

customer_reviews.title: Nice try -- one flaw ruins it
customer_reviews.text: Everything is good about this machine, but one. And that one, for me is a killer. The pot that inserts into the rice cooker heats by conduction -- the heating element has to be in contact with the bottom of the pot. The pot is so thin-gauged that mine as already heat-warped. Which means this tool is going to be nearly useless over time. I suppose I could replace the pot but I've only used it about 7 or 8 times so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sanpaku

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for a few months now and have used it a handful of times. I’ve done both rice and veggies at the same time and it worked wonderfully. I’m very impressed with the unit for the price I paid. Walmart wants more than twice what I paid for this. Not this time, Walmart... not this time.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hudgins

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE my new Aroma cooker
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my new Aroma cooker! We have used it to steam rice, veggies, and have utilized the slow cooker function for multiple pork roasts to make pulled pork for sandwiches already. I don't know what I ever did before I bought this... I use it constantly! You can steam veggies AND rice at the same time, which is a DEFINITE win for us busy people. I highly recommend this product to anyone in the market for a rice cooker AND a crockpot... it takes the place of BOTH of those small appliances, and therefore, half the real estate on your countertop.
customer_reviews.author: MommyTo2Princesses

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Crockpot
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for just a slow cooker without a pressure cooker. This has been an amazing crockpot! It automatically turns down to keep warm when your food is done cooking! Would recomend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Mysterious outlook

customer_reviews.title: BAD SMELL
customer_reviews.text: After one month use, I am regret than getting this because It got a bad smell inside even I clean it regularly, but you cannot wash its led which has a plastic piece that in contact with the steam of the food and the bacteria can grow over there and you cannot take it out and wash it.
customer_reviews.author: Forogh

customer_reviews.title: Works good!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use rice cooker. Can be used to steam other foods as well but we just needed a rice cooker. Extremely easy to use with a small booklet on how to use with common foods. It will switch to warm after it’s done processing which is a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Bullutz

customer_reviews.title: This unit saves time & $
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly cooks rice & vegetables for a delicious dinner. Free downloadable recipe book is full of interesting dishes.
customer_reviews.author: Alen

customer_reviews.title: Cooks rice fast!
customer_reviews.text: Thia thing hammera out 4 cups in 15mins. Way faster than my old aroma rice cooker. I like all the other settings too. I was able to slowcook in this too. Its like having another crockpot
customer_reviews.author: Xynoize

product_meta.title: Aroma Housewares 20 Cup Cooked (10 cup uncooked) Digital Rice Cooker, Slow Cooker, Food Steamer, SS Exterior (ARC-150SB),Black
product_meta.description:
Style Name:BasicThe new and improved Aroma 20-Cup Digital 3-in-1 Rice Cooker, Food Steamer and Slow Cooker is designed to cook a good variety of dishes. The new function Flash Rice cooks those tough-to-cook grains quicker. Now get your homemade dinner ready in a snap!

This convenient cooker perfectly yields 4 to 20 cups of any variety of rice with specialized functions for both White and Brown Rice. Once the rice has finished, it will automatically switch to Keep-Warm so there's no need for monitoring or stirring. The Steam Tray allows for healthy steaming of meats and vegetables, even as rice cooks below! 

With Aroma's Slow Cook function your rice cooker transforms into a 4-quart slow cooker, furthering its use as a meal-making powerhouse. The programmable 15-hour delay timer is great for families on the go, delivering delicious rice ready when it's needed. And when the cooking is done, the inner cooking pot and all accessories remove for easy cleanup.

Steam Tray, Rice Measuring Cup and Serving Spatula included. BPA free
feature_bullets: Multi-functional use – whether you are in the mood for a hearty jambalaya, steamed veggies and rice, or even a fluffy cake (Yes, cake!) you can accomplish it all with Your arc-150sb cooker. The possibilities are as creative as you are.

Nutritious & delicious – the built-in steamer function allows for nutrient-rich meals to be prepared above while rice, Soup, or any other meal addition cooks below, allowing you to save time without sacrificing quality. This Multicooker not only includes all of your favorite cooking options, but also possesses the unique options of slow cook and saute-then-simmer STS, making meals rich, tasty, and a guaranteed family favorite.
Capacity & Dimensions – The arc-150sb has a 20-cup cooked capacity yielding anywhere from 4 to 20 cups of cooked rice and measures 11.1" X 11.2" X 10.8". Power Consumption- 120V/60Hz 860W

User-friendly programming – this product is also a proud member of our “set it and forget it” mentality. The cooker is incredibly simple to operate using our user-friendly digital panel that switches to keep warm automatically once cooking is finished allowing you the freedom to take back your time instead of worrying while you cook.
Accessories – this rice cooker includes a non-stick inner pot, rice measuring cup, and a plastic rice spatula.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars7,366 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
